metadata.subject: U.S. Justice Department to discuss consumer protection at social media meeting

organizations: House of Representatives Energy and Commerce Committee

relationships.description: Attorney General convening meeting with state officials
President criticizing social media outlets for alleged bias
State officials investigating and suing technology companies

analysis.purpose: To report on an upcoming Justice Department meeting about social media companies and consumer protection concerns
analysis.significance: Documents government scrutiny of major tech companies regarding alleged political bias and data privacy issues

notable_quotes: "The U.S. Justice Department said on Monday it will hold a 'listening session' with officials from more than a dozen states on Tuesday to discuss consumer protection and the technology industry"
"Sessions will meet with attorneys general or representatives from California, Louisiana, Missouri, Nebraska, and Texas, among others"
"Twitter Chief Executive Jack Dorsey responded at the hearing that some platform's algorithms had been changed to fix the issue"
red_flags: Pending lawsuits against major tech companies

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this news article

illegal_activity.description: This is a Reuters news article reporting on government investigations and allegations, not first-hand evidence of illegal activity

details: Article by Reuters journalists Jan Wolfe, Lisa Shumaker, and Rosalba O'Brien
References to media coverage of tech company controversies

public_knowledge.context: This Reuters article covers publicly announced government meetings and ongoing investigations that were widely reported in 2018

analysis.summary: The U.S. Justice Department announced a meeting with state attorneys general to discuss concerns about social media companies allegedly suppressing conservative voices and potential consumer protection violations, with specific focus on Facebook, Twitter, and Google amid ongoing state investigations and lawsuits.
